reviews.sentence: Needs Renovation. Stayed in the Hotel for 4 nights this month. Being lean season was able to get a good room rate. Check in process was smooth and quick. Was upgraded to the next level room being a Taj Inner Circle Member. However was not impressed with the room even though it is quite big. The carpet was smelling and we requested the housekeeping to remove it from the room. The linen had blood stains and had to get that changed too. The towels in the bathroom too had stains and had to get them replaced too. The bathroom was big too however the fittings were all very old and seriously need to be upgraded. Or maybe the room is kept in this way to cater to the people who like the old lokThe hotel restaurant is quite good though breakfast. Lunch dinner wal all nice. The hotel location gives it an advantage being close to Express Avenue mall. However would have second thoughts about staying here again unles there is some good renovation done.

Gr8 Ambience Huge Well Maintained Heritage Property. We a family of five went to Chennai by our XUV on 30th morning and checked in the hotel at 1215pm. We already booked two rooms aprox. three weeks in advance. We gave our preference of adjoining rooms and near to elevator. They honoured our preferences and booked the adjoining rooms with one door in between. One room had more space so one extra bed could be acomodated in that. The staff at the reception was quite cordial and polite. All of us checked in both the rooms and luggage was also got settled in both the rooms with the help of trolley. There were special pillows which could relax your neck muscles as it used to take the shape accordingly. Everything was neat clean well placed. Tea coffee maker with essentials mineral water newspaper electronic safe ironing table electric shaver etc. were in both the rooms. Bathrooms have bathtubs and shower area and all the toiletries were placed as well. Bath hand face towels were nicely placed. Check in time was 140pm and check out time was 120 but we had to check in a little early as we informed them well in advance. We had an appointment booked for 1330pm at US Consulate and booked the taxi from reception and it reached at 1245pm so we reached there in time. After return from there we relaxed and had evening tea and roam around. Swimming pool atracted my sons family so they got into the pool. We found the property quite huge and very well maintained. We had dinner in room dining was also available. The stay was inclusive of buffet breakfast so next morning we had it in Verandah which was the restaurant for this purpose. A large spread of Continental Southindian Northindian cuisines was there. Outside one themed restaurant was there for southindian dinner with everything made out of clay. Next morning. we had an appointment for 930am so booked the taxi previous night from reception for 845am. It reached on time at the same place. We finished all our interviews and returned to hotel and our luggage was already packed in the morning itself as it could take more time at Consulate. We had relaxed. peaceful n enjoyable stay with staffs hospitality courteous and always smiling faces. It was exclusive of 125 luxury tax 84 service tax as well.

Good Centrally Located Hotel. this Taj hotel is located centrally in Chennai and it is old property built in way back 1846 and later on took up by TAj roms are spacious with all amenities. each room has sit out table and chair apart from working desk and chair old furniture excellent condition WiFi is free the buffet break fast is good spread and the south Indian filter coffee is superb.

Excellent experience and good. It was a very good experience in Vivanta. The staff and services are very good. The rooms are well equipped and clean. The inside decoration also very good. The location is in the heart of the city still there is no noise. I will definitely prefer in my next visit to Chennai.

Absolutely stunning and wonderful place. Well when it is Taj what can someone say. Starting with Checking the trademark Taj hospitality is there through out. The rooms are simply superb and the food is too good. The Taj hospitality is extended to room service which is extremely prompt. The activities part is well taken care of with multiple avenues being available for every person in the family. With great food experience and varieties available for foodies it is a great place. Overall complete Taj Tatas hospitality at its best.

Taj Conemara Vivanta. A hotel which has kept its colonial interior. Spacious clean rooms with a selection of 3 restaurants small gym and lovely pool a real oasis away from chaotic Chennai. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Fabulous 160 year old building beautiful rooms spotless service very nice a bit sleepy though Rating may change after dinner.

Stay in a White marble palace like a maharaja. The Taj Conemara is a palace of white marble awaiting the weary traveler in the hot and dusty city of Chennai. Service was exemplary staff were extremely attentive. I do n’t know if I was luckily given a suite or if rooms are just large but the room I had was sumptuous. The bed was a California king with the finest linens. Downsides were the room had so many switches it was ridiculous. Over 15 light switches. In my haste to get to bed I inadvertently switched a switch with tiny writing that said “ do not disturb ” the next evening I returned to my room to find my bed unmade. My fault I guess I did n’t read the small print. There were two 50 inch flat screens but getting them to work was something between a divine art and an enormous waste of time. Breakfast was very good although I suspect the dinner restaurant that is part of the hotel but next door gave me a bad stomach upset. Food was spicy and good just wish it had been hygienic its the only place I ate before the stomach issues hit. I did not suffer such issues at other 5 star hotels. Rooms were quiet. Shower water pressure excellent. Overall highly recommended.

Good. Rooms are really nice and the overall property extremely nice after the renovation. However food is quite average. Thanks to Anish at the Verandah for taking good care and understanding the issues.

renovated hotel with long history. This is a colonial era hotel in central chennai that has recently gone through a renovation and rebranding from a business hotel to the more appropriate heritage and hospitality forcus it has now. The staff is great and really welcome you. The heritage wing is really that. The wooden staircase and the hallways feel from a different era. And the rooms are charming with antique furniture but also modern amenities. One reviewer found the renovation to be incomplete in his room but I ’ve stayed there twice since the renovation once in what they call the luxury wing and once in the heritage. Both were renovated though with a different focus. The heritage rooms they are preserving the charm and antique furniture. The rooms in the ” luxury ” wing are larger and that part of the building dates from the 1970s and have modern furnishings. I prefer the heritage rooms for their charm and quiet isolation from the road. The luxury room did get a lot more sunlight due to larger outside facing windows but that also seemed to tax the a c a bit as far as I was concerned. The heritage room I stayed in did have a smaller window looking out to a shaded garden area on the side of the hotel but that was fine for me.

The musty room smell was very overwhelming. However the staff gave us a new room. Put a dehumidifier. The staff went out of the way to make us comfortable. The room had a stuffy musty smell to it. Even the bedding had the same problem.

Not very bad except for the three reasons 1. Due to work we checked into hotel only at around 7 PM Out of the two rooms one was emanating heavy smoke smell although it was a non smoking room. Immediately we informed the same after one of Your representative personally visited and sensed the same told she would arrange another room. But after around 45 mins asked us to check the room again they sprayed room refresher and that smell was too much dominant I had a 3 years old infant so I disagreed to take the room and requested for another room. She tried to convince us to take the same room repeatedly but I refused. Then we went out for dinner and got another room in another floor upon return around 10 pm. Before giving rooms please check it thoroughly if is good enough for Your patrons to stay2. While booking the heritage room it showed the area as 64 Sq. Mt but in person I saw it is hardly around 250 sq. feet. It is the worst form of advertising did not expect from the reputed concern like TAJ3. We have ordered for a 1 KG cake one day in advance in person at the restaurant and Informed them we would pick it up by 120 noon on 21st July. When I went to the restaurant at 1 pm I was asked to wait for around 45 minutes. I was told the cake was ready but the box to pack the same is not available and they are searching for it. 4. Food was good in restaurants good ambience receptive and employees esp those in the raintre restaurant.
Can do better. Kindly change the shower heads in washroom. They are very bad. Overall I think the hotel can consider changing other fittings in the bathroom that are too old.

Very Good. Food was good. Staffs as usual welcoming. We could n’t sleep in the heritage room as there was quite lot of mosquitoes. Our little one got bite marks all over the face After we complained we got room in higher floor which was okay. Veranda Restuarent service was not up to the expectations. We had to request for cutleries tissues etc. But I must say the food was very delicious.
Wonderful. Good staff and facilities. Good pool. Water was leaking out of the bath area and onto the bathroom even when the door was shut.
Expect a decent room. no other attractions. Cumod in room was old and not reflective of a good qualityMosquitos in swimming pool at night.

Satisfactory can be better. An antique style hotel very close to US consulate. It is a great place to stay and friendly and courteous staff. A couple of things that can improved room cleanliness and restaurant experience. Room was good but had a lot of dust at some places I doubt that the AC vent is pimpin in the dust. They should be more careful about keeping the room extremely clean and dust free. Restaurant experience can be improved.

Could have been better. 1. Booked for double occupancy yet the room was prepared as per single ocupancy2. Bathroom had a very strong pungent and disturbing odor of some kind. 3. Compulsory English even when the guest is not comfortable.
Excellent. I found some stagnated water in the rest room. Try to take necessary steps.

Very Good. Great help from reception and very good car service. Delightful pool. Delicious Indian food in Verandah cafe. Large comfy room. Elegant building. Very nice bar. Hair balls on the floor in our hallway. Mildew smell in room. Room not made up until late afternoon though we left at 7 am. LOUD piped in music in the cafe and corridors. Grubby grunge on all doors to cafe pool rest rooms. This charming old place needs better supervision of cleaning and maintenance.
